Yes, Cardiff University offers a range of scholarships to international students who wish to study in the university. Some of the scholarships are:

1. Vice-Chancellor's International Scholarship: This scholarship provides full tuition fee waiver and a stipend to cover living expenses for international students undertaking the undergraduate or postgraduate taught programs. 2. International Foundation Programme Academic Achievement Scholarship: This scholarship is available to students who achieve excellent grades in the International Foundation Programme and provides a reduction in the tuition fee. 3. Cardiff Elite Athlete Scholarship Scheme: This scholarship provides support to high-performance student athletes who wish to pursue their studies at Cardiff University. 4. Commonwealth Shared Scholarship Scheme: This scholarship is available to students from Commonwealth countries who wish to undertake a master's degree on any of the university’s eligible courses. These are just a few examples of the scholarships that are available at Cardiff University. They offer numerous types of scholarships to international students across different levels, programs, and subjects. For more information on scholarships and eligibility criteria, please visit the university's official website.
